intro: Boechera fecunda, commonly known as the rockcress, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. This species is characterized by its basal rosette of leaves and small, white or yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. Boechera fecunda is often found in rocky or gravelly soils, thriving in arid and semi-arid environments. It is also noted for its ability to produce seed pods that remain attached to the plant long after flowering.
